meanings.definition: A person who grabs or seizes something.
meanings.sent1: The grabbler quickly snatched the toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The grabbler at the party took all the snacks without sharing.
meanings.sent3: The grabbler in the movie stole the spotlight with their amazing performance.
meanings.sent4: Her cat was a grabbler, always pouncing on any moving object like a skilled hunter.
meanings.sent5: The grabbler's hands were always in motion, reaching out for anything within reach.

meanings.definition: To grab or seize something quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: She grabbled the last cookie before anyone else could get to it.
meanings.sent2: The kids grabbled for the balloons floating in the air.
meanings.sent3: He grabbled the opportunity to showcase his talent on stage.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to grabble away from her as she rushed to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel grabbled the nuts and scurried up the tree before anyone could stop it.
